io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.target  

How to use this library to implement custom synchronization feature

Smint.io base library for synchronizing assets from our Enterprise Buying Platform to downstream targets, like Digital Asset Management (DAM) software.

This base library makes integration of the Smint.io platform and synchronization of assets from Smint.io to any target a breeze. A basic infrastructure to run one-way synchronization is provided by this library. Synchronization of meta-data and assets is targeted from Smint.io to any kind of downstream target system.

What to implement to make it fly with a synchronization target

To make it work with a sync target, you need to implement the interfaces from the package io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.target. Although you will need to implement all of these interfaces, the most important of this package are:

  • ISyncTarget
  • io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.configuration.IAuthTokenProvider
  • io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.configuration.ISettingsModel

How to provide your implementation to the sync library: Factory or dependency injection

In order to provide your implementation to the synchronization library framework, you need to provide a factory, implementing the interface io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.factory.ISyncFactory. There is a default implementation available as io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.factory.impl.SyncFactoryFromDI. This class can be used even if you do not have any dependency injection available. Nevertheless using any DI framework would be helpful. There is an example how to use io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.factory.impl.SyncFactoryFromDI in the documentation for that class.

Initialize the synchronization process

Initialization is performed utilizing class SmintIoSynchronization. 

ISmintIoSynchronization smintSync = new SmintIoSynchronization(
    new SyncFactoryFromDI(
        new MyAuthTokenStorageImplementation(),
        new MySettingsModelProvider(),
        () -> new MySyncTargetImplementation()
    )
);
smintSync.start();
